website_summaries.verdict: A modern domed litter pan with steps designed to wipe cats' paws clean.
pros: Designed with steps that not only create interest for you and your cat but also remove litter from your cat's feet
Works especially well to minimize odors
cons: Some owners say cats may still track litter from the pan and advise placing a mat beneath it

website_summaries.verdict: The best covered litter box for keeping your dogs out of the litter.
pros: Clean steps effectively prevent litter from scattering on the floor
Interior of box is spacious and inviting
Provided filters and dome design keep unpleasant odors at bay
The entryway is large enough for most cats, but curves to prevent dogs from getting into the litter
cons: Litter box is quite heavy and is difficult to move

customer_reviews.title: Very messy.
customer_reviews.text: There is a channel that the lid slides into and if your cat pees against it, it'll follow the channel and go down the stairs. Just spent 15 minutes cleaning it. I will be getting a different litter box after this
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Nice and BIG
customer_reviews.text: Way bigger than I expected! When I first saw it I regretted buying it because of the size. However, my cat does love it so that's all that matters. I ordered the color Titanium just because it was cheaper and luckily the color is much nicer in person! It's basically a beige color. The stairs do catch most of the excess litter, but not completely. Also I wish the lid actually snapped in place; it just sits on top, so if you have a dog that you are trying to keep out of the litter box, they might still be able to knock the top off.
customer_reviews.author: Que

customer_reviews.title: Already tossed it out
customer_reviews.text: This litter box does not keep dogs out or reduce mess. The entry to the dome is wide open to the section with litter, so it actually makes it easier for dogs to get into it than a regular covered box. This also makes it so that the cats are continuously kicking litter onto the 'steps' and straight out of the box. Also, the lid does not connect to the bottom, just sits on top, so it's quite difficult to move. I tried it for about two weeks before throwing it into the trash and bringing out the old box.
customer_reviews.author: Carpe Librum

customer_reviews.title: No replacement filters
customer_reviews.text: This model does not have replacement filters. I've searched high and low to no avail. You will have to buy oversized filters and cut them down. As you can see from the photo, the replacement filters sold for the Petmate Clean Step Litter Dome are round, yet this dome requires a strange size. Round filters do not fit under the clips to hold them in place. Furthermore, they leave gaps around them. I'm very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S

customer_reviews.title: Avoid This
customer_reviews.text: The top does not lock on. The cats knock the lid off enough that their urine runs down the side and out of the box. Also, the inside is entirely too small. The size neither holds sufficient litter for more than a day, nor does it give enough room for the cat to maneuver. The stairs do nothing to stop litter tracking. The cats, due to the small size, always knock litter over the edges into the stair region. The litter then rolls down the stairs and into the floor. Finally, the shape of the box makes it impossible to change the box without making a mess, especially because of the litter which the cats knock into the stair region.
customer_reviews.author: chiggybug

customer_reviews.title: Pretty big
customer_reviews.text: This is significantly larger than I expected but still very pleased. I had hoped the most enclosed nature of this would help with odor as my kitty is using it, but alas no luck. But that is more a kitty issue rather than the fault of the litter box. It is very easy to clean, especially if you use liners. But... the lid does not really stay "locked" in place. I've bumped into it only to have the lid slide to the side. Note... I bumped into it, I did not crash into it. (Although truthfully that has happened as well, I can be pretty clumsy)
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my French bulldog away from "kitty cookies"
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 cats and a dog who loves kitty "cookies." I've had a hard time keeping my dog out of the litter without making it difficult for my cats to access as well. So I bought this one as a last ditch effort. It works very well at keeping my kind of beefy Frenchie out of the litter. Even if she is able to get her head in (her shoulders are too wide), the litter is far enough away and receded into the box enough that she can't get into it. Only down side is that it is a bit bulky. So be sure to have a rather large space for the litter box to sit.
customer_reviews.author: Klasina Isome

customer_reviews.title: this litter box sounded like a good idea
customer_reviews.text: At first, this litter box sounded like a good idea, but in the end, it turned out to be a disaster. - The box itself is very big but nearly half of it is taken up by the steps, leaving a very small area for litter. - The interior is very dark. - It is very hard to get the litter liner in. - There is no locking mechanism between the top and the bottom, and the bottom part is low, allowing the cat's urine to leak out to the floor. We threw it away after a month and went back to a basic hooded litter box.
customer_reviews.author: Spring

customer_reviews.title: Pretty But Not the Most Practical
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my 2 male cats were occasionally spraying over the top of their open box. The positives: It keeps the pee in the box. It is a very attractive box. The negatives: My cats regularly spray the sides of the box and it smells. The box is quite large and oddly shaped, which makes it difficult to clean and empty out. Today I changed the litter and thoroughly cleaned the box. If your cat(s) do not spray and the attractiveness of the box makes it worth the inconvenience of cleaning it, this box could be a good option.
customer_reviews.author: taam 1

customer_reviews.title: Litter SPILLS EVERYWHERE!
customer_reviews.text: I should have returned this litter box after changing it the first time. It's round (obviously) and every time I dump the liter box, it spills all over the flow. This is due to having no corners. The one side close to the stairs you can pour out of, but then all the litter on the stairs goes directly on the floor. I hate it... and am now actually looking for a new box.
customer_reviews.author: TANYA R SWEET

customer_reviews.title: LITTERaly the best!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best investment as far as having an eager beaver in the litter box... We have 2 adult cats one of which would sling litter everywhere no matter what type of traditional litter pan we tried.... This thing has LITTERaly "pun intended" Keeps the litter in its place and gives them privacy.... I added a battery powered motion sensor disc light inside so as soon as they poke their head in it comes on....they took to it right away. Also added the gorilla mat and it works great and is very hefty.
customer_reviews.author: richard

customer_reviews.title: Best litter box ever!
customer_reviews.text: Omg I love this litter box! My 16 year old cat has arthritis in her hips and was having issues getting into her old one. I then got her one that was low in the front, but litter came out of it easily and some urine would be on the floor. Was awful. But this one is not only pretty but it keeps all the litter inside and they can’t miss when they pee since there is a cover. The stairs are nicely placed on the side so it doesn’t take up more room. Great deal for the price, I would have paid more!
customer_reviews.author: Alissa

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised, love this litter box!
customer_reviews.text: We used to have the Omega litter box because it seemed more convenient for scooping. We were pleasantly surprised when we started using this one, because it's actually much easier to use-the lid it comes right off really easily, but it stays on really well for the cats. It gives you lots of space to the scoop. And there's lots of room for the cats to enjoy their litter box, because it has kind of a high ceiling due to the dome. The cats love the stairs and the privacy and the extra space! Also, the stairs really do prevent more litter from getting out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Sabinchen

customer_reviews.title: Not Exactly Cleanstep ..
customer_reviews.text: Though attractive, Petmate’s Booda Dome Cleanstep litter box DID NOT keep its promise of catching litter. My 10 year old cat is pretty clean overall but, for some reason, this box was the messiest she's ever used. That includes a no-frills, rectangular box. The enclosed dome did seem to contain litter scatter from the sides most of the time; but, the top frequently came loose (as some other reviewers have noted) so litter did get out. It would behoove Petmate to include small latches to connect the top and bottom pieces. I will be returning the box.
customer_reviews.author: tlgf1968

customer_reviews.title: Arrived dirty & defective. Stops tracking. In theory prevents dogs
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with slight manufacturing defects (corners/edges missing/dented). Was very dirty on arrival. I was worried it was a used one they stuck a new label on. Spent some time bleaching and disinfecting it (whols reason I didn't buy a cheap used one that I saw locally was I worried about diseases so not too impressed this was so dirty). Top and base do not hold together well so I have to tape it to prevent my dog from going after the cat poop. My cat took to it without a problem. It does stop litter tracking significantly, which has been great as my cat really throws the little about and walks it everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Del Rosario

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye cat stink.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my cat needed to be fixed, but I couldn't stand the smell while I waited for an affordable appointment. Also, I hated walking in cat litter anytime I was within 10 feet of the old box. Wow. This thing works so well!!! I never smell it and I never ever, like ever step in cat litter anymore. It feels good. BTW, it is a little awkward to clean because my cats always want to go pee the second they get past the stairs to the actual litter. So, there is like a giant, soggy clump of pee right in the most narrow point of the box. Definitely not a deal breaker for me.
customer_reviews.author: liberty

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had not bought this - design does not work
customer_reviews.text: Sorry but have never given this rating before. it is just a bad design - terrible problems putting plastic bags in - I had the correct size but bag has nowhere to grasp around to stay in place. Bought this item to try and control litter - in fact it was worse than current cat boxes I have. Cat wee went all over the place due to lack of full liner placement. Would not recommend at all.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymouse

customer_reviews.title: Cuts down on litter outside the box, but...
customer_reviews.text: There's no way to take it apart to clean the steps, and the steps trap litter. Dealing with it every day with the handheld broom or vacuum is the only way to keep it clean; otherwise, the litter on the steps eventually gets tracked outside the box. My cats tend to dirty the sides and one actually peed on the steps, so keeping it clean is a regular fight. After a few months, I have given up on this litterbox and am now making one out of a plastic storage box. So continues the never-ending quest to find the perfect litterbox solution. I have spent hundreds and keep going back to DIY models.
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: We ALL love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. I have 3 cats and 2 are male. They are great with the litter boxes I already had, but, they "cover" with great vigor and my porch is always a mess! My female is older and stays in the house, but, the look of an open litter box was disgusting. It took them several days, actually a few weeks for the boys, to even go in them. But, now? They use them almost exclusively. I'm cleaning the open litter boxes much less frequently. I love that there really isn't any more cat litter small and 95% less litter on my floors! I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: B. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Litter stays on the stairs and not on your floor! Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 cats really took to this dome. They have enough space, the lid has a handle for easy removal, and the filter is amazing for containing smells. The only thing that is difficult is changing the litter out, not just scooping mess, but a full overhaul of all litter in exchange for fresh litter. It is way too big to fit in a normal size trash bag and dump out. I end up shoveling as much as I can before I pour the rest out in the bag. Also, I recommend hosing/rinsing between litter changes. My cats usually get some mess on the inside walls and the smell lingers on the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Gia

customer_reviews.title: Huge!!
customer_reviews.text: The litter box arrived with no damage as others have had issues with. It is enormous! Kid you not. It is one of the largest boxes I have seen but that just shows that I didn't pay attention to the measurements. I purchased it mainly to prevent my dog from getting at any cat feces and it does the job. As you can see by the photo, we placed the opening close to the wall. Our small dachshund can't get at the litter at all. It has solved the problem at this point. I would recommend this litter box to others.
customer_reviews.author: jansvendsen60

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning the tracked litter out of the steps was super annoying. It was an upgrade from what I ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would solve my cat's litter tracking problem; it didn't. Nothing has solved this problem. This was a pain in the butt to clean. The lid is huge, so taking it off to scoop was a pain. It didn't keep my laundry closet from getting litter dust all over it. Cleaning the tracked litter out of the steps was super annoying. It was an upgrade from what I had previously, but now I have the Omega Paw Self-Cleaning Litter Box, which I like better.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Jurkovic

customer_reviews.title: Serves Its Purpose with Room for Improvement
customer_reviews.text: This litter box has pros and cons. Pros: - litter catching steps - enclosed shape reduces odor Cons: - dark color allows little light to filter in - the litter basin is only about 65% of the surface area due to the stairs - our larger (lengthy) cat has difficulty fitting in the box and sometimes misses the litter basin and hits the stairs - our cats removed the top filter multiple times and destroyed it This box may work for your kitties, it certainly does the job. However, I suggest a few design tweaks to improve functionality.
customer_reviews.author: LosDosGibs

customer_reviews.title: Very easy for cats to enter and exit
customer_reviews.text: My youngest kitten absolutely loves this litterbox. My older cats also like the steps and the ease of getting into this new box. My prior letter box was one that they had to jump on from the top to get in. Both available to them and no one is using the old litter box. The downside is the box and the top Don't stay attached very easily and can easily get off track. My kitten tends to try and play with the box so sometimes knocks the lid off. They can't loves to bring her q-tips that she's not allowed to play with into this litter box to hide them from us.
customer_reviews.author: Tori D

customer_reviews.title: Good for small cats, not so much for normal/big cats.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this box was wonderful - it has an interesting design, looks pretty dang good, and helps prevent smell. Unfortunately... my cat thought otherwise. The actual litter pan part of it is quite narrow (unless you have a kitten) - half the space of the entire box is the “stairway.” It’s not necessarily “difficult” to clean, but it’s certainly not easy, either. The shape of it makes getting corner clumps a bit of a pain in the a**. Because the pan part is so narrow, my 11 pound cat refuses to use it unless the top is off... totally defeating the purpose. However, if you have a small cat, I could see it working out very well!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother failed for many animals I own
customer_reviews.text: My friend has this and said it helped keep down on the litter coming out of the cat litter so I fell for it and bought one first of all this thing is big and awkward yet it's still too small for cats to go in and it made my room even Messier like the litter got out twice as bad. I have everything from a 5lb Siamese to a 25 lb Maine Coon it actually causes cats to start having accidents in the house they did not like the box that much and I've never had problems before with my cats they're all therapy animals well trained send it back and got my refund
customer_reviews.author: Meadow Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I have a little kitty with mobility issues and a pup who likes to treat the litter box like it’s his own personal buffet, so I’ve been looking for a litter box solution that will keep the dog from snacking but will still allow my kitten easy access and independence of access. This litter box was the answer to my litter box woes. My kitten can easily get in and out whenever he needs to, and the poop buffet is officially closed for business. <cue heavenly chorus of angels>
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Good litter box
customer_reviews.text: This is not a small litter box but it works well. The steps help keep most of the litter from tracking out. We have a mat in front of it to catch any litter that the steps don't catch. The steps and entrance also keep our dog from getting into the litter. The filter helps keep some of the smell at bay but my kittens keep pulling the filter into the litter box and burying it so I have stopped using a filter, which makes the smell much stronger. I would love it if the filter sat on a grate or something that the kittens couldn't pull it through.
customer_reviews.author: Jaydub

customer_reviews.title: Dome spacious easy clean litter box
customer_reviews.text: This litter box is a great size for a cat to have plenty of room to do his/her business and to dramatically cover up #1/#2. The steps to interior help to keep litter in the box. The only two things I feel should be improved is 1) the place for the filter as it is loose fitting so my cat constantly removes it 2) it should have lock snaps or something to keep the top and bottom together. It is hard to carry a dome shaped litter box to wash it because it doesn’t lock together. Otherwise, it is great. The size is spacious and it is easy to clean out.
customer_reviews.author: JDLA

customer_reviews.title: Nice but could use improvement
customer_reviews.text: The seclusion of the litter box helps shy cats not find places like behind the couch! Several aspects could use significant improvement. The ramp does not do a great job of cleaning litter off the cat's feet, it could be a little more aggressive. The round shape and rounded bottom make scooping everything out fairly difficult, there are not square points to scoop against. The footprint of the litter box is huge compared to a traditional litter box and severely limits out of the way spots to place it.
customer_reviews.author: MRH0171

customer_reviews.title: Great litter box just an awkward shape
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these ive gotten and i really like it. It is my favorite. For a non self cleaning container its nice not to have to look inside everytime you pass by and gives my cat some “privacy”. I do have to put a mat underneath it for fallout. Cleanup is a little tricky since its round and wider than a regular trashbag. I just wrap the bottom and pour it in, once you do it a few times it is easy. Keeps the odor in for the most part, with filters you can buy at target. You really dont need to buy them often at all though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the dog out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this so our dog would stop eating cat crap, she can't get into it. She's a medium sized dog about 45 lbs, smaller dogs may be able to get into this. I recommend putting a small weight on top of the lid or attaching a latch of some kind to the lid. We found that the dog could move the lid without the weight on top. After a few attempts to lift it she left it alone. If you're looking for something to keep your dog from having Brown treats this is the catbox for you. I've attached a picture showing the 2.5 lb weight placed on top of the lid.
customer_reviews.author: Paulryanp

customer_reviews.title: GINORMOUS. Make sure you understand measurements
customer_reviews.text: I read measurements, researched, etc. but STILL didn't expect the indoor dog house... i mean litter box, lol that I received. Not only was there not a good place to put it but there's no way I could keep up the maintenance on it. Too bad they don't make a smaller one w/ the steps. You definitely have to have a house. I would think it practically impossible to clean if you didn't have a way to spray it out outside.
customer_reviews.author: Stasia

customer_reviews.title: It is huge and perfect for multi cats.
customer_reviews.text: I needed it to look stylish for when guest were over. I also didn’t want anything hard to clean. This is real easy. The top just sits on not locking which is fine. My cats go in and out without knocking it off. It is easy to just life the lid off and clean. It is all rounded so no corners for stuff to get stuck in.
customer_reviews.author: Pbonner

customer_reviews.title: Best box ever!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried from the picture that the litter area wouldn't be very large, but it's very generous. I needed to replace the open-top box in my coat area because the coats were tending to drop in, and litter was getting kicked into shoes. I didn't know how the casts would adapt from the jump-in-the-top one they love, and a fully-enclosed box. I didn't have to worry as is was instantly their new favorite box. I love that it's large enough for big cats; sleek enough not to be an eyesore; and the "step" area does seem to keep the litter tracking down, and the curved design stops litter from being kicked out. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: MamaOwl

customer_reviews.title: Needs Improvement
customer_reviews.text: I would like this litter box SO much more if the carbon filters that you purchase separately (that are suggested/labelled SPECIFICALLY for this box) actually fit. This box has truly helped contain my kitten's mess and the filter that it comes with greatly helped to decrease the smell left by my furry friend, but the carbon filters that are purchased separately are too small and do not fully fit the shape of the top. This needs to be improved. Other than that, I would rate the box itself at 4 stars. :)
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: a bag cannot be used under the litter sand because it will show from the outside and it would look terrible. So
customer_reviews.text: It eliminates the odor, hides the poop, and gives the cat her own privacy and her own "bathroom". However, a bag cannot be used under the litter sand because it will show from the outside and it would look terrible. So, sand has to be placed directly in the litter box. It's very easy to scoop poop, because you just lift the roof and place it back on once your done. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, but terrible to clean and leaks often
customer_reviews.text: There are pros and cons to this dome. I had one five years ago, but this version isn’t up to the same quality. It is a nightmare to clean, we have tried 3 different types of litter, but unless your cats goes in the middle of the dome, then you will be scraping and constantly cleaning the sides. You have to make sure that the top is down properly or it will leak. After a few weeks of having it, the top already seems to be misshapen where it sits on the bottom. Disappointing to say the least...
customer_reviews.author: H.ROBS.79

customer_reviews.title: Top does not latch to the bottom
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would love this. The dogs also loved it which is the main reason we bought it thinking the dogs would stay out of it. The top does not latch & it took these big mutts no time to figure it out!! So the locking feature does not exist... yet (hint- please add). And for some reason- it's not the litter boxes fault- my cats decide to go potty everywhere but in this box. We put the old one back out & haven't had an issue. Bratty cats said *I don't like this nice roomy pee box*. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Robin R

customer_reviews.title: Does not perform as promised
customer_reviews.text: It's supposed to keep the dog out of the litter but it doesn't. The dog is a 15 pound dachshund mix and she definitely can still get to the poop treats with this box. I image a big dog would not be able to get in there. It does result in less litter on the floor than the previous box but there is still enough litter coming out of there to be annoying. It's a little difficult to get the round bag completely inside the lock feature. The design leaves a little hole that the bag doesn't fit into completely. I'll probably replace it when I figure out what will actually work.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Herring

customer_reviews.title: If only I could rate less than one star
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to purchase a new litter box for our cats and after reading the reviews and seeing that the majority were positive I felt I had made the right decision. Oh how wrong I was. The litter box too doesn’t click and latch with the bottom section so when the cats pee it leaks out. It also says that the box is made for larger cats and that isn’t true either. Overall I’m horribly disappointed in this product and now I have decided to give up and just go purchase another litter box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent option
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 7 year old cat who is a little on the chubby side because her previous box was a little too cramped. After purchasing this box I rescued a 3 month old kitten. This box was a WONDERFUL investment for both cats. It is spacious enough for my older cat and easily accommodates the extra waste of an active kitten who uses it frequently. It is easy to clean and I really like how it has steps that lead into the box. That really helps cut down on the litter that is tracked out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Wall Piddles are a Thing of the Past
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats. One cat always wants to piddle on the wall next to the litter box. Vet recommended this litter box. I keep two litter boxes and bought one of these for comparison. Both cats prefer the domed box rather than an open air one and are using it exclusively. The one cat still tries to piddle inappropriately; however, the piddle stays in the box and not on the wall. Would I buy again? Yes, I already have to replace the other box. Problem (hopefully) solved. My only criticism is that I wish it was a little bigger. My other boxes were gigantic and these are much smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: My 16 year old Cat refuses to use it.
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a nice product but I rated it a 3 as my cat doesn't like it and won't go near it. Of course he is 16 and set in his ways and probably scared of it as it looks like a space ship. I put litter in it or I would have returned but I had no idea he wouldn't use it as I thought he would love it! It was a waste of money for me though as it just sits there and he uses his old litter boxes. I can't rate it a 1 as how would a company know what cat would or wouldn't accept it.
customer_reviews.author: cindy hause

customer_reviews.title: Have a "tall"  spot picked out , it's pretty tall .
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to keep one of our dogs out of the cat's litter box. I know , it's disgusting and it had become a very real problem. This solved the issue perfectly ! The dog cannot get inside and i think maybe the cat enjoys the privacy more than the open litter box gave her. It is easy to clean and the top stays on just fine, even when the dog tried to bump it with her head to get it off. She gave up after trying a few times. overall a very good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Its not very expensive compared to other dome/housed litter boxes. But the footprint is small, it does have a little catwalk (which if you place a cut litter mat on, works perfect) and its good size for 1 good size cat. At first he was finicky, now he sh*ts in style. Got his own outhouse son what else could a cat ask for. Not easy to clean, but what litter box truly is. Fits in an unused closet, of mine, keeps the door propped just enough for him to get in and some light.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: It's great, almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: This litter box prevents my cat from jumping out and spilling litter everywhere. Granted, it doesn't completely stop the litter from sticking to my short haired Japanese Bobtail, but after installing a mat, the litter doesn't spread outside of the litter box region. My only wish is that they sold plastic linings for this box since cat fecal and urine stains plastic with both color and smell. I have to make a makeshift plastic lining every time I replace the litter in whole.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Yang

customer_reviews.title: Confusing
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this in September 2018, after 3 months of trying to get either of our two cats to use it we gave up. It is not easy fior them to get into the area where the litter is and our older car who we bought it for would go up the steps but back himself out because he couldn't get to the litter area. I'm mostly disappointed that I tried to contact the manufacturer for ideas but never got a response. Make sure you have young cats that can learn with this box it will probably work very well. Seniors don't like it lol.
customer_reviews.author: Sheena Jennings

customer_reviews.title: It is also great with smell
customer_reviews.text: We have a dog who likes to steal "brownies" from the kitty litter box. This was our last attempt to find something that deterred her from looking for "treats" and it worked!! Or only other option was to give the cat her own room...... Our dog is a small shitzu about 10 lbs and for her to get into the box, shed have to go up a ramp and around the corner. She would definitely fit, but I think the fact that she cant see it anymore helps a lot. It is also great with smell, keeps the smell in and easy to clean. Cat loves it (she told me so)
customer_reviews.author: Kaylee M.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I love this for kittens. Makes it really easy for them to get in and out of it. My other cats like it as well. I added two motion sensor lights in the top of it from the outside top pointing downward. They light up when the kittens or normal size cats get on the steps. They love that. They do it just to set them off. If you have a larger cat like ohhhh 15 lbs.... no ... just no. He's not really gonna fit with the top on. Mine tried and failed and ended up with a mess on the steps to clean up
customer_reviews.author: SCMOM

customer_reviews.title: regret it
customer_reviews.text: i havent even started using this yet, but totally regret getting it, big time. i can see how it would easily leak, it is big, but with no corners- it doesnt fit that great- the top doesnt fit snuggly or well, leaving gaps (hence could leak), and other reviewers are right- it is going to be literally impossible to pour to empty and change. it looks better quality in the pictures than it is. i am debating sending it back- but since returns- i have to drive to the mall or ups store it is a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona

customer_reviews.title: Great for Two Cats
customer_reviews.text: I am very very pleased with this litter box! It is very big, but with two cats, bigger is better. Both kittens are not scared by the litter and have no issues walking up the ramp. The top portion does NOT lock onto the bottom, it just securely rests there. The kittens, however, do not knock the top piece off and it’s easily removed for cleaning. I am really happy with this! It helps keep the smell to a minimum, especially with the filter on top.
customer_reviews.author: Maura

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to clean with the rounded sides and the steps are super hard to clean. With the shape, you don't have a corner to pour from to empty it out well into the trash. Pee can leak out the seam where the cover sits and leave behind a mess under the box. The lid doesn't lock into place, and is often difficult to settle correctly onto the box. And it's super hard to clean up the litter tracked down the stairs. We tried for a long time, but continue to hate it, so we're finally getting a covered rectangular box again.
customer_reviews.author: interiorlulu

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Keep it all out of sight. Does a pretty good job of keeping the smells in the dome too. About twice a month or so I will soak the black filter that goes on the top of the dome in vinegar and wash it off. I would also recommend buying a motion sensor light and sticking it to the top of the dome on the inside. I bought a pack of these and used one on the litter dome.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Big Box but Worth It
customer_reviews.text: The cats had no issues adjusting to an enclosed litter box and actually seem to enjoy this much more. It also keeps me sane because they can roll around and play in the litter and the crescent shaped area where the litter goes keeps it all in. The steps work well too to keep litter from tracking. It is a very big box, but worth it if you have the space. The smell is gone as well and we have 3 cats using it! You can’t even tell when they’ve gone to the bathroom. Before we could smell it for a few minutes afterwards. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Uzbeccahstan

customer_reviews.title: Cat Didn't Have An Issue
customer_reviews.text: Switched it out and my 13lb cat didn't have an issue at all. It's pretty spacious (from what I can tell, not personal experience) and I like that fact that my cat now walks out of it rather than shooting out like he did with the last one and got litter all over the place. You can see all of the litter that's left on the steps and not on my floor. I have this combined with the Gorilla mat and it seems to be working well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Less litter on the floor
customer_reviews.text: We've been using these for years, and love them. There's less litter tracked onto the floor because a lot of it gets left on the built-in steps. I do vacuum that out every so often so the cats don't have to step on it, but it's way better than us having to walk through litter constantly. It can be a tad tricky to clean because it's round and the scoops on the market are flat/squared-off. But as long as you have a good clumping litter, it's doable.
customer_reviews.author: Cody C

customer_reviews.title: Great litter box!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this litter box. We have had it about two weeks now. We have two large breed dogs that can no longer get into the litter box! This box also does a good job of keeping the smell away and keeping the litter inside the box instead of everywhere else! Only thing I'd change is that the litter box does not lock closed; you cannot carry it by the top handle and that kind of sucks. But otherwise we're very happy with it. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: sarah bombard

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love this, but it was pure YUCK.
customer_reviews.text: I saw a few reviews with the same issue I had, but bought anyway since the vast majority of the reviews are so positive. As a few others have said, my cat pees so the pee goes out the side and down onto the stairs. Really gross to clean and causes strong odors. Just super gross. Maybe it would be less likely with a petite kitty, but did not work for our med/large cat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The worst litter box in the world.
customer_reviews.text: This was advertised as preventing dogs from getting in. There is NO locking device. The lid just sits on the bottom. Due to the round shape of the box the litter scooper doesn't clean since scoopers are flat not round. I installed heavy-duty velcro strips, but it wasn't strong enough for my little stinker and he easily ripped those off and got into the litter. Additionally, this is an extremely large litter box with a lot of the room taken up by the stairs leading into it. Don't buy this unless you want to abuse yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Lucille

customer_reviews.title: Good product, bad cats!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this to work out for our family of three cats. One had arthritis and cannot jump, one is slightly overweight, and the other has his own top entry litter box. Everything was going great until one of our cats took a huge crap on the stairs of this litter box! And that one crap turned into everyday crap on the stairs. I couldn't take the maintenance to keep this thing properly sanitized and clean, with my cats pooping in inappropriate places and then dragging it all over the house. Needless to say we bought a different style but this might work for some better mannered cats than mine!
customer_reviews.author: Soulakham

customer_reviews.title: Small Pan
customer_reviews.text: This was a great idea, but in reality a big misstep. The staircase takes up so much space that the actual room for cats to do their business in is tiny. Definitely not great if you have 2 cats. May be ok if your a solo cat family. And if you happen to have a cat the just steps in and pees, watch out for pee running down the staircase. 100% would not buy again. We’ve only had it for a few weeks and I’ve already ordered a new one without steps and a deeper pan.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Big Enough for a 15 Pound Cat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for the steps. Our Maine Coon would shoot right out of his old litter box and track litter everywhere. I wanted something that would help cut that down and came across this and gave it a try. It works as I've noticed a significant difference in the lack of litter on the floor and carpet. He also doesn't seem to mind the shape and its dome lid. It's big enough for him (15 pounds) to move around in and he and our little 5 pound cat share this without any issues. I haven't had any problems with it breaking/chipping and the quality seems to be good.
customer_reviews.author: DMB

customer_reviews.title: I loved it so much I decided to buy a second ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved it so much I decided to buy a second one. We have 5 cats. we could never actually find a litter box that could hold the smell and the mess (since I have a very smart cat who always pooped right on the edge of the little box, how? i have no idea) It also helps the sand not to be everywhere since it has steps and the steps have tiny bumps that hold up the sand. On the top the filters holds up the smell. Just a recommendation: Don't remove the cardboard that comes on the door because it actually helps even more with the smell :)
customer_reviews.author: Mariana

customer_reviews.title: Good so far!
customer_reviews.text: First off, this litter box is huge. It should have been labeled a full size feline porta potty! LOL! Literally just got the litter box today and it seems great so far besides the crack near the handle. I am assuming the crack occurred during the lovely handling process by the delivery driver as the box was crushed. I had hoped that it would be better packaged for these reasons, but I guess not. Despite the crack, everything Still seems functional! Not sure how to “lock” it though..... trial by error I guess!
customer_reviews.author: ~Country Mom~

customer_reviews.title: This litterbox smells. The filter does nothing to stop ...
customer_reviews.text: This litterbox smells. The filter does nothing to stop the odors. I purchased this litterbox since my cat was having difficulty getting in and out of his last one due to the ramp but I wish I had purchased a different product since my apartment now stinks of dung whenever he uses it. I have tried a new filter and have put the lid on securely, nothing stops the odors. I did not have this problem with my previous litterbox and did not change my cats diet since purchasing this so my only conclusion is that it is the box.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t catch litter on steps.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this litter box because of the “steps” that were advertised to cut down on the kitty litter that gets outside the box. I figured between this and a kitty litter catch mat that it should keep the litter mess down, but that’s not the case at all. I still have kitty litter literally all over the place and very little of it is actually caught on the steps. This litter box is giant and I would go for a normal covered box next time I shop for one.
customer_reviews.author: Annamaria

customer_reviews.title: Needs work
customer_reviews.text: It is not bad. It can be manageable. However, the lid likes to pop off if you move it 'wrong' and I have more times then not ended up with my hands gooped up because of an incident like that. Yuck! The 'steps' do an ok job of helping to contain SOME of the litter, but lets all be realistic, if you have an indoor cat, litter is part of your life and invades all over the place in the end. So, not bad, but beware.
customer_reviews.author: Janel A.

customer_reviews.title: Great (and big)
customer_reviews.text: Got this because my cat is a senior with arthritis. I use can liners and throw all contents out every few days. Pretty big product, but definitely like the look of it compared to an open box. Only thing is sometimes my cat decides he doesn’t want to use the ramp and jumps the little divider, which makes it 10x harder and means he trips, but that’s just cause my cat is too prideful to admit he’s not 2 anymore.
customer_reviews.author: King Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Good design, cats all like it and it is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: The first one I ordered arrived damaged during shipment, but the replacement one was fine. (The first one was damaged, because, the lid turned upside down and the box had no support and was crushed. I noticed when the replacement came the lid was still in place and it offered the ONLY support for the shipping box, no bubble rap, paper, foam, or other protective packing material was used. I would but again and recommend. However, better packing and protective packing material should still be added by the Sellers.
customer_reviews.author: The Reaper DRR  TM

customer_reviews.title: Good size and cats liked it
customer_reviews.text: Looks just like it was advertised and my cats seem to be okay with it . I have one cat that’s super social and the other is very shy so the very shy one is slowly getting used to it but the Social one used it three times the same day lol it’s not huge but it’s not small my fat cat fits just fine !! I also like the idea that my litter is no longer scattered everywhere because they are forced to come out one exit versus having the ability to jump out from any direction with my old litter box .
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Picky Cat
customer_reviews.text: You never know if your cat is going to like something and I was convinced she was gonna hate this. I followed some advice with an online forum with new cat boxes (she had been using the same box for 6 years (just cleaned really well and maintained; she’s picky AF)). They said to keep any lids off the box so they get used to the space and I did that for four days (they said two weeks; uh, no). She took to it fine. Now it’s normal for her and I’m happy. It also helps with cat litter being sprayed about, I love that.
customer_reviews.author: FernGullyJones

customer_reviews.title: 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.text: This litter box is awesome. It is a lot bigger than I anticipated but that is a huge plus. I have multiple cats so the bigger the better. The domed top helps disguise that it’s a litter box and keeps the litter box odor contained. I have to to keep my kittens away from it sometimes because they like it too much (they think it’s a playhouse lol) but other than that it is excellent. It did help to take the top off of it for a few days at first to let them get use to it being a litter box.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great for older cats who miss the box
customer_reviews.text: We adopted an older cat who was missing the box multiple times per day. The smell and mess was getting unbearable. This box is great because it has a ramp which is easy for her to climb, and is totally enclosed so she cannot miss. Hurray - no more changing puppy pee pads and no more smell. She seems proud of herself too that she is not creating a mess. We give her lots of positive feedback.
customer_reviews.author: Chicago customer

customer_reviews.title: Good box! Not scarily huge.
customer_reviews.text: Nice, not as big as I feared from some previous reviews. The top doesn’t cover the filter so my naughty kitties have gotten their paws on it and used it as a toy a few times. Stairs do prevent a surprising amount of tracking! Used the cooking spray and baking soda technique to avoid pee clump. Overall, a good litterbox. Knocking a star for the filter issue, and the fact the top and bottom don’t have a way to fasten shut. My kitten has scared my big cat badly a couple of times and said big cat has knocked the lid right off. Might look into some kind of on/off fastener.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not the same Booda
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first Booda last year and loved it. Unfortunately, I accidentally damaged it so I ordered another one. I'm not happy with the second one at all. The plastic seems thinner. The lid doesn't quite fit and urine seeps out of the side. I have it for a few months and I noticed the side of the bottom part now has a dent it in ( it didn't have the dent when it arrived). I scrub the box every week and I can't seem to completely get rid of the smell. It is almost like it has soaked into the plastic. This one just doesn't seem be as good quality as the first one.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Purty cool
customer_reviews.text: Okay so this thing is awesome at prevent the litter scatter my cat was leaving with a traditional litter box. Overall I do recommend it. Just be aware it is quite large because of the dome and will not be easy to tuck away. The shape also makes it kind of a pain to clean, especially the litter that gets tracked down the stairs, but I’ll take it if it means there aren’t litter specks all over my room.
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: My cat hates it.
customer_reviews.text: My cat hates it, enough that she held her bladder so long that she had an accident on the bed. I think it has to do with the lack of air flow to help the silica based litter dry the urine out, I think it would be fine with traditional clumping litter. Also, it's huge, we have a decently sized bathroom and it takes up so much space, more than the hamper and more than the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: raygracy

customer_reviews.title: No more litter EVERYWHERE!
customer_reviews.text: Game changer! My cat kicks so much litter out that every day I had to vacuum. Not anymore. This is a miracle. It looks cuter than a traditional box and it’s so cute to watch my diva cat go up and down the little stairs. It’s very spacious so I don’t have to empty it as often. Would be great for 2 cats as well. Should’ve gotten this years ago. It was a steal compared to the Petco/Petsmart prices for the same box.
customer_reviews.author: Thais Rochard

customer_reviews.title: Great for decreasing litter 'trackage'.
customer_reviews.text: 'Taz' is quite enthusiastic about ensuring he covers well when he's "done". This box has entirely stopped litter being kicked out of box. While it doesn't entirely stop all litter 'trackage' out on Taz's paws- it significantly reduces it.
customer_reviews.author: DL Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Misleading
customer_reviews.text: This little box is nice in that it is covered but the steps do not prevent litter from getting out of the box. I have two cats that share this box and after a couple uses there is litter in front of the box where the exit is.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy!!!! At first it seemed ok then we started noticing pee on the wood floor. It took a bit to realize when the cat pees on the side of the box it leaks out the seam. BAD BAD BAD damage to my flooring. To top it off now the cats smell it on the floor and just pee on the floor now no matter how much bleach I used. All the high rating are because they only just started using this.
customer_reviews.author: Dannie

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t live up to expectations. Cute to look at.
customer_reviews.text: My dome come in good condition. No cracks and lined up correctly. It is very roomy inside and easy to clean. However my cat still kicks litter out and it ends up all over stairs as well as outside the dome. I’ve also noticed I smell cat pee a lot easier with this box not sure why that is. I clean it daily and as soon as my cat pees you can smell it. Maybe because it has a large open entrance and our old cat box had a door on it so kept smells in. Not sure. I wouldn’t recommend this dome litter box
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great Litter Box!
customer_reviews.text: My senior cat LOVES this litter box! And he isn’t able to easily track the litter all over the floor, although he does still manage to get some on the floor. You have to take the entire top off to clean it, which was a nuisance when we had it under a table but we moved it to a corner that’s in the open and now it’s not a problem anymore.
customer_reviews.author: NLMN

customer_reviews.title: No litter anywhere!
customer_reviews.text: My kitten is an over-achiever in covering "his business". At just 3 months he can shoot litter a good 2'. This solves that issue and he took to it quickly. I left the lid off for a few days and when I put it on he was a bit confused and leaped into the litter from the middle of the steps, and did the same leaving. It only took a few days for him to figure out how the ramp works. He is too little to easily get into the other covered litter boxes entrance so the ramp was perfect for him.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Less mess
customer_reviews.text: This is our third litter box for our cat. She is a messy cat and usually leaves litter everywhere when she leaves the litter box. With the stairs on this litter box, the mess is minimal! The only thing I dislike about the litter box is the top just sits on top of the bottom piece. It does not lock into place, making it very hard to move around. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: It’s a pain to clean steps. Apparently my cat likes to toss the liter over in that direction. It would be much better if there was a guard up or something. I’ve looked high & low for locking & found none. So the top is always moving. & if the cat pees somehow high it leaks thru crack & onto the new wood floor. So that’s nice. It’s a bit cumbersome so I wouldn’t recommend for a small space at all.
customer_reviews.author: CosmoGirl

customer_reviews.title: Too small, too curvy, too sticky
customer_reviews.text: A single day of use for this dome, and everything stuck to its sides. It easily scratched from the scoop and from claws, and heaven help you if you use a square scoop, as there is nothing square inside. It's shallow, and the portion that actually holds the litter is far smaller than one would expect. My geriatric cat would not have been able to get around in there comfortably had I ever installed the lid, nor would he want to cram himself into that tiny space and become trapped. The carbon filter has no bracket holding it in, more than once a paw from a kitten climbing on top pushed the filter out.
customer_reviews.author: Jo S

customer_reviews.title: Lid is not secured at all, beware dog owners : (
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this litter box because I struggle with dogs who just can't help themselves sometimes and the entryway on this box seemed like a good alternative to the normal flap entry or even the top loading litter boxes which dogs can still easily get into. What I did not realize is that there are NO locking mechanisms on this box at all, nothing at all to keep the lid secure. It's bad enough that my cats keep knocking the lid off and making a mess, but the dogs can all easily nudge the lid off as well. Disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Its HUGE
customer_reviews.text: So, this was MUCH bigger than anticipated, BUT it works out since I also have a larger than life cat. So, I bought it to prevent my 67lb dog from eating kitty snacks, and it sort of works. It works if I put some scotch tape on each side to keep Bar from lifting up the top half. I saw some reviews mentioning pee getting between the lid and the bottom, but with weekly wipe downs , I haven't noticed that problem. The steps catch a TON of paw litter, so my bathroom floor is clean other than a few bits here and there. I wish it was smaller, but it works for me!
customer_reviews.author: Hardwurkindaddy

customer_reviews.title: Easy lid placement
customer_reviews.text: This has been a game changer for my cat. The lid is easy to put on and remove. It has a groove on the inside to keep the lid in place, it works well considering my cat uses it as a booster to jump on the counter. My two small dogs still cram their heads in the box, but this deters them slightly. When looking at all the different covered litter boxes, I'm glad I picked this one.
customer_reviews.author: MommaOf3

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for keeping pups out and floor free of litter particles.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic litter box. Keeps all the litter inside and hides it away around the “stairs/ramp” from my pups who love to dog the litter out of the box like it’s a personal play sand box! It was also $11 cheaper than my local pet supply store. I purchased two of these now because they work so well! Also contains odor better than traditional boxes. 1 star for locking because it doesn’t lock. The top just sits inside and on top of grooves but it has never moved or fallen off!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Limits Litter Getting on the Floor
customer_reviews.text: My litter robot died and I didn’t want to spend a few hundred dollars on a new one. My cat was getting litter all over the floor and I needed something that would limit that. Bought this box and it works pretty well. Most of the litter gets trapped on the steps which leaves less getting on the floor. Also, the charcoal filter seems work well with limiting the smells coming from the box.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Miles

customer_reviews.title: No more litter all over the floor
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually like doing reviews but I really like this one. It took a few hours for my cat to figure it out but I kept telling him he would get a treat when he used it. Lol. He kept stepping inside then backing out so I took the top off the first time he used it. The next time he went straight in. He is around 16 lbs and fits fine. And he's 15years old. So if he can figure it out, younger cats should be able to do it also. The steps hold the litter so far. Well worth the money for me to not constantly be sweeping that stuff up.
customer_reviews.author: wmal

customer_reviews.title: Better than the regular box.
customer_reviews.text: Still doesn't keep my particularly tenacious cat from kicking litter all over the place but, in fairness to the product, he's basically a fuzzy mental patient who approaches litter-flinging like he's a pro in an Olympic sport. It does keep the dust from the scoopable litter from spreading as much as it was BEFORE we got it. I like to spritz a bit of poo-pourri on the filter on the top to contain the smell a bit more. You may not need to do this if your cat is halfway sane and doesn't take his sadistic revenge by dropping biohazard-level bombs every time you have company over for dinner. Also, don't serve mashed potatoes and gravy.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy D.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't live up to the described features. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: This item was disappointing. The design is cool-looking, but impractical. The curved design makes it difficult to scoop with a straight edged scoop. There should be a scoop that fits the design included with this pan. The excess litter collects on the steps, and is tracked out like it is with the regular pans. I try to brush this excess off when I scoop, but it accumulates with the first use, and is tracked out. Basically, I spent more money for nothing better than a 'regular' litter pan. A small rug works better than this design in curtailing tracked litter, and costs less!
customer_reviews.author: margy

customer_reviews.title: The cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I love it because the cat loves it. We moved and were concerned about all the usual cat adjustment issues, in this case from an open box in the garage to an inside the kitchen one. From the first time he saw the box, Mao approved; for the first few days he'd just go inside, check it out and come back out with a pleased expression. He continues to use it with enthusiasm. For us, it's easy to keep clean, the charcoal filter controls odors and it's as unobtrusive as a covered dome in a small kitchen can be.
customer_reviews.author: pls1

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We have medium sized dogs that love the cat litter boxes. I ended up putting 3 Velcro strips on it to keep the lid secure because the dogs were knocking it off sticking their heads all the way in. After I installed the strips though they can't get the lid off, can't reach the litter area and have since given up trying. This litter box works great. If I had any suggestions it would be to include some Velcro strips.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Great kitten/adult litter box.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a kitten starter box, but my adult cats like it as well. The stairs help the kittens in and out of the box with minimal litter scatter. Because of the oval pan design, I use a food skimmer (spider design) for a litter scoop. The top doesn't actually lock, but aligns and fits together with the base securely. I recommend this litter box.
customer_reviews.author: soloangel58

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the dog out
customer_reviews.text: I replaced this with a litter box that had to be placed against the wall to keep the dog out. This box does the trick plus. It is easier to clean due to the angles of the sides, keeps the litter dust down and Jemima the cat is happy that litter is easily removed from her feet as she walks down the ramp. I also have not noticed any cat box odor. Pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lola

product_meta.title: Petmate Booda Dome Clean Step Cat Litter Box 3 Colors
product_meta.description: Color:Brushed NickelThe Petmate Booda Dome Cleanstep Cat Litter Box helps keep floors free of litter-scatter with grooved steps that gently clean kitty paws. The dome is equipped with a charcoal-filter that traps odors as they rise from the cat litter pan, allowing confident placement in any room of the home. Featuring an easy-lift handle and a rounded, non-stick plastic pan, cleaning the litter dome is quick and simple. This covered cat litter box securely encloses cats for privacy and keeps litter hidden from sight. Measuring 21 by 21 inches, this large cat litter box is ideal for households with multiple cats or larger cat breeds. With a unique design available in three attractive colors, the dome offers an attractive alternative to standard litter boxes.
feature_bullets: DOME LITTER BOX: This cat litter box with dome lid encloses cats on all sides, ensuring privacy while keeping floors litter-free. The grooved clean-step entrance gently wipes cats' paws as they exit.

CONTAIN ODORS: This kitty litter pan features a charcoal filter for the dome that absorbs odors so it can be placed in any room of your home. Perfect for multicat homes & larger cat breeds. 21" x 21".

PET CLEAN UP: Swiftly clean up after your dog or cat while at home or on walks with a variety of waste management products. From waste bags, rakes, pans, trainings pads to poop scoopers, litter boxes & litter, we've got you & your pet covered.

Petmate: For over 50 years, we at Petmate are passionate about our dogs, cats & furry friends in general. Starting with the very first dog kennel, we've produced plenty of eco-friendly products that pets will love.

JUST FOR PETS: Petmate makes a variety of pet products for dogs, cats, chickens & other small furry friends! Check out our brands such as Aspen Pet, Arm & Hammer, Booda, Chuckit!, Jackson Galaxy & more!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
